key_points: Dave Halls, assistant director, has a history of neglecting safety measures on film sets, leading to multiple injuries.
Halls did not use a recommended crash pad for actress Carol Sutton, leading to her injury on the 'Freedom's Path' set in 2019.
Sutton, who passed away at age 76, was injured after falling over in a scene due to inadequate safety measures.
Quinton Rodriguez, a first assistant camera operator, recalled an incident where Halls failed to call 'Cut' when a crew member was injured on set.
Halls was fired from 'Freedom's Path' after a gun unexpectedly discharged, injuring a crew member.
This firing was prior to the 'Rust' incident where Halyna Hutchins was fatally shot after Halls handed Alec Baldwin a loaded gun.
Rodriguez provided new details about the gun discharge incident on the 'Freedom's Path' set.
Despite being fired for the gun discharge, Halls continued working in the industry, leading to the tragedy on the 'Rust' set.
Producers of 'Freedom's Path' declined to comment on the prior incident involving Carol Sutton.
Producers confirmed Halls was removed from set immediately after the prop gun discharged on their film.
